column1: Acid Splash	Acid	You hurl a bubble of acid. Choose one creature within range
column2: or choose two creatures within range that are within 5 feet of each other. A target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 acid damage. This spell’s damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6)

column1: Astral Projection	All	at least 100 gp
column2: all of which the spell consumes) Duration: Special You and up to eight willing creatures within range project your astral bodies into the Astral Plane (the spell fails and the casting is wasted if you are already on that plane). The material body you leave behind is unconscious and in a state of suspended animation; it doesn’t need food or air and doesn’t age. Your astral body resembles your mortal form in almost every way
column3: replicating your game statistics and possessions. The principal difference is the addition of a silvery cord that extends from between your shoulder blades and trails behind you
column4: fading to invisibility after 1 foot. This cord is your tether to your material body. As long as the tether remains intact
column5: you can find your way home. If the cord is cut—something that can happen only when an effect specifically states that it does—your soul and body are separated
column6: killing you instantly. Your astral form can freely travel through the Astral Plane and can pass through portals there leading to any other plane. If you enter a new plane or return to the plane you were on when casting this spell
column7: your body and possessions are transported along the silver cord
column8: allowing you to re-enter your body as you enter the new plane. Your astral form is a separate incarnation. Any damage or other effects that apply to it have no effect on your physical body
column9: nor do they persist when you return to it. The spell ends for you and your companions when you use your action to dismiss it. When the spell ends
column10: the affected creature returns to its physical body
column11: and it awakens. The spell might also end early for you or one of your companions. A successful dispel magic spell used against an astral or physical body ends the spell for that creature. If a creature’s original body or its astral form drops to 0 hit points
column12: the spell ends for that creature. If the spell ends and the silver cord is intact
column13: the cord pulls the creature’s astral form back to its body
column14: ending its state of suspended animation. If you are returned to your body prematurely
column15: your companions remain in their astral forms and must find their own way back to their bodies
column16: usually by dropping to 0 hit points.

column1: Blade Barrier	Slashing	You create a vertical wall of whirling
column2: razor-sharp blades made of magical energy. The wall appears within range and lasts for the duration. You can make a straight wall up to 100 feet long
column5: or a ringed wall up to 60 feet in diameter
column7: and 5 feet thick. The wall provides three-quarters cover to creatures behind it
column8: and its space is difficult terrain. When a creature enters the wall’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there
column9: the creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save
column10: the creature takes 6d10 slashing damage. On a successful save
column11: the creature takes half as much damage.

column1: Bless	N/A	You bless up to three creatures of your choice within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends
column2: the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw. At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher
column3: you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

column1: Blur	All	Your body becomes blurred
column2: shifting and wavering to all who can see you. For the duration
column3: any creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you. An attacker is immune to this effect if it doesn’t rely on sight

column1: Burning Hands	Fire	As you hold your hands with thumbs touching and fingers spread
column2: a thin sheet of flames shoots forth from your outstretched fingertips. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 3d6 fire damage on a failed save
column3: or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried. At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher
column4: the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

column1: Chain Lightning	Lightning	You create a bolt of lightning that arcs toward a target of your choice that you can see within range. Three bolts then leap from that target to as many as three other targets
column2: each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or an object and can be targeted by only one of the bolts. A target must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes 10d8 lightning damage on a failed save
column3: or half as much damage on a successful one. At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher
column4: one additional bolt leaps from the first target to another target for each slot level above 6th.

column1: Cone of Cold	Cold	A blast of cold air erupts from your hands. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 8d8 cold damage on a failed save
column2: or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature killed by this spell becomes a frozen statue until it thaws. At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher
column3: the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

column1: Death Ward	All	You touch a creature and grant it a measure of protection from death. The first time the target would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage
column2: the target instead drops to 1 hit point
column3: and the spell ends. If the spell is still in effect when the target is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantaneously without dealing damage
column4: that effect is instead negated against the target

column1: Delayed Blast Fireball	Fire	A beam of yellow light flashes from your pointing finger
column2: then condenses to linger at a chosen point within range as a glowing bead for the duration. When the spell ends
column3: either because your concentration is broken or because you decide to end it
column4: the bead blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame that spreads around corners. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes fire damage equal to the total accumulated damage on a failed save
column5: or half as much damage on a successful one. The spell’s base damage is 12d6. If at the end of your turn the bead has not yet detonated
column6: the damage increases by 1d6. If the glowing bead is touched before the interval has expired
column7: the creature touching it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save
column9: causing the bead to erupt in flame. On a successful save
column10: the creature can throw the bead up to 40 feet. When it strikes a creature or a solid object
column12: and the bead explodes. The fire damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren’t being worn or carried. At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher
column13: the base damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 7th.

column1: Disintegrate	Force	A thin green ray springs from your pointing finger to a target that you can see within range. The target can be a creature
column3: or a creation of magical force
column4: such as the wall created by wall of force. A creature targeted by this spell must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save
column5: the target takes 10d6 + 40 force damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points
column6: it is disintegrated. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying
column8: are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell. This spell automatically disintegrates a Large or smaller nonmagical object or a creation of magical force. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of force
column9: this spell disintegrates a 10-foot-cube portion of it. A magic item is unaffected by this spell. At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher
column10: the damage increases by 3d6 for each slot level above 6th.

column1: Earthquake	Bludgeoning	You create a seismic disturbance at a point on the ground that you can see within range. For the duration
column2: an intense tremor rips through the ground in a 100-foot-radius circle centered on that point and shakes creatures and structures in contact with the ground in that area. The ground in the area becomes difficult terrain. Each creature on the ground that is concentrating must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save
column3: the creature’s concentration is broken. When you cast this spell and at the end of each turn you spend concentrating on it
column4: each creature on the ground in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save
column5: the creature is knocked prone. This spell can have additional effects depending on the terrain in the area
column6: as determined by the DM. Fissures. Fissures open throughout the spell’s area at the start of your next turn after you cast the spell. A total of 1d6 such fissures open in locations chosen by the DM. Each is 1d10 × 10 feet deep
column8: and extends from one edge of the spell’s area to the opposite side. A creature standing on a spot where a fissure opens must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall in. A creature that successfully saves moves with the fissure’s edge as it opens. A fissure that opens beneath a structure causes it to automatically collapse (see below). Structures. The tremor deals 50 bludgeoning damage to any structure in contact with the ground in the area when you cast the spell and at the start of each of your turns until the spell ends. If a structure drops to 0 hit points
column9: it collapses and potentially damages nearby creatures. A creature within half the distance of a structure’s height must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save
column12: and is buried in the rubble
column13: requiring a DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check as an action to escape. The DM can adjust the DC higher or lower
column14: depending on the nature of the rubble. On a successful save
column15: the creature takes half as much damage and doesn’t fall prone or become buried.

column1: Etherealness	Psychic	You step into the border regions of the Ethereal Plane
column2: in the area where it overlaps with your current plane. You remain in the Border Ethereal for the duration or until you use your action to dismiss the spell. During this time
column3: you can move in any direction. If you move up or down
column4: every foot of movement costs an extra foot. You can see and hear the plane you originated from
column6: and you can’t see anything more than 60 feet away. While on the Ethereal Plane
column7: you can only affect and be affected by other creatures on that plane. Creatures that aren’t on the Ethereal Plane can’t perceive you and can’t interact with you
column8: unless a special ability or magic has given them the ability to do so. You ignore all objects and effects that aren’t on the Ethereal Plane
column9: allowing you to move through objects you perceive on the plane you originated from. When the spell ends
column10: you immediately return to the plane you originated from in the spot you currently occupy. If you occupy the same spot as a solid object or creature when this happens
column11: you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space that you can occupy and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved. This spell has no effect if you cast it while you are on the Ethereal Plane or a plane that doesn’t border it
column12: such as one of the Outer Planes. At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher
column13: you can target up to three willing creatures (including you) for each slot level above 7th. The creatures must be within 10 feet of you when you cast the spell.
